bibl.title: Despatch from Goby, December 8, 1866
Despatches from United States Consuls in Gaboon, 1856-1888 T-466

text.body:
<div1 xml:lang="en" type="document"
<pb facs="20170615_113838"
We Rear-Admiral Commandant Superior of the Settlements of the Gold Coast and of Gaboon.
Where as it appears by the Ministerial seaport od January 15th 1866 that the Government of the Empiere is devious of receiving the mother country of those Colonial expenses which are of a purdy local character.
Whereas in our Circular dated September 21st that we informed Mefors the traders of the eva of annual protests and biemdues to commence on January 14th 1867.
Considering that the local trade has not yet contributed any thing to the public change od our settlementsand and that the Execution of the colony finds itself *unclear* to modify the state of things.
Upon the proposition of the Commander Particular officiating as justice of the Peace and the Cordinator as Minister of the Interior.
Have devised and no dated Aug 1st The annual protest and
<pb facs="20170615_113842" at Gaboon shall b e assessed according to the following tariffs Muchants patient...800 francs Retail dealers patient ...400 francs
The annual license dues at Gaboon are fixed at 600 francs Oct. 2nd Under the heads of Merchants on comprised all those whose principal brings councils in recieving merchandise direct from abroad and in expecting the produce of the Colonys
Oct.3rd Under the head of Retail dealers are comprised all those who recieving from abroad only the small portions of their goods, purchase the remainder from merchants and consigeures reselling afterwards, partly by some whole sale partly by retail without expecting my native produce.
Oct.4th Are subject to license d*unclear publications, eating *unclear* billion soon supress and google shope and others selling liquor by retail in then establishments.
The payment of *unclear* will be <pb facs="20170615_113846" exempt from taking out a patent for any other business or profession carried we simultaniously and subject to patent dues.
Oct.5th Masters and Superargoes selling their cargoes on ship board or shore by wholesale or by retail will be subject to take out a patent, the amount of which shall be determind according to the value of the goods which the manifest shall attribute to them the propritoes consignment.
The dues for this patent will be payable for each destined voyage whatever maybe the destination of the stay in the Colony.--- They are fixed as follows; For a cargo above 1000 to 10,000 francs + 300 francs For a cargo of 1000 to 10,000' a 200 frs.
Oct 6th. Below one thousand francs the goods will be considered as a simple private montese belonging to the Master or Supercargo who in this can will have no patent dues to pay.
Any person in charge of a cargo who shall sell in shore other merchandise than those of which he has made the
the <pb facs="20170615_113850" declaration to the Executives, shall be punished by a fine fixed at the rate of the annual patent dues void of the description of business in which he is Lseed*unclear
The patent dues occuring to the Treasury by virtue of the present article will be fixed by the Executive on sight of the manifest.
Oct 7th With the exception specified by the proceeding article 4 in that which concerns the *unclear*, no one will need to take out more than one patent, whatever may be the different branches of business in which he is engaged boats the patent dues will be payable on the mmost important class of business carried on
Nevertheless a single patent came only noon* the establishment hold, upon the same premises and under the mine firm or by the same person.
The merchants patent will only come on retail store in the *unclear of his establishment. <pb facs="20170615_113854"
Partners undoubtly forming the same and sole house of business or trade have only need of one patent for the form.
he classification of persons subject to patents and licenses according to the 2,3,+ 4 articles here into for motivational will be settled up between the 20th and 25th of December of each year
Oct 8th The list of those holding patents and license will be prepared by the Ordermatur* and submitted to the Commander Super to be rendered executory.
The collection of the dues shall be made by the Treasurer in the usual manner and at the permits before an after appointed Oct 9th The patents and licenses shall be taken out in the two first months of each half year for the entire half year but convert be granted for permit of the half year.
The dues for patents and licenses shall be paid
For the first half year before the 15th of July For the rest half year before the 15th of Aug.
<pb facs="20170615_113859"
Those who may undertake a profession a trader or an occupation in the course of a half year, which is subject to a patent or a license will only be both to pay the dues for the quarter book not for a less period than a quarter.
They must pay their proportion in the month of their starting in business. No patent or license will be granted or renewed except upon the production beforehand of the reciept for the dues.
Oct. 10th Those persons holding patents or licenses who have not paid their dues at the time here in before mentioned will rein from the Treasuer a notice free of cost.
Just days after the notice those in near will recieve are exact of the list rendored indeed excenting by the Commander explain with order to pay.
In default of doing within the period of three days the formation and goods of the defaults will be *unclear*
<pb facs="20170615_113903" and sold to the amoubnt of patent or license dues and of the expenses to which the proceeding may have given rise.
Oct.11th No person will allowed to follow a profession or occupation subject to patent or license dues without having first made a declaration at the office of the Executives, and under taken to pay the regulation tax.
The traders subject to license dues most also enter into an engagement to conform to the practice ruler and to the forms of closing their establishments.
A certificate of those declarations and engagements will be delivered, which will be exchanged later for the patent or licenses as the case maybe
Oct. 12 Any trader who is unable to produce his patent or license to the Agents of the Executive or in line of it the proof that he insens*unclear on the list of those holding patents and licenses or the certificatw required by the proceeding article, will be <pb facs="20170615_113907" punished by a fine od 20 to 100 fran without projudice* to the payment of the patent or license dues which he may have defrauded which dues he shall be compelled to pay for the entire year even if he should give notice of giving up his business.
Any person who may carry on a trade supenor* to that for which he has taken a patent will be made to pay the difference and a fine equal to that difference.
Any person subject to patent or license dues who may chose time his trade or representation is found to make his declaration thereof to the Executive beforehand provided alway that the payment of dues for the half year commander consent be dispersed with.
The will reciever a certificate of his declaration so long as this formally has not been comprised with the trader will be considered as continuing his business and
<pb facs="20170615_113911" subject to pay the tax.
Oct. 13th All complaints relating to patents or licenses must be addressed ti the Cordinator who will give his opinion there on to th party entrusted.
If the party presents in his complaint, the matter shall be referred to us with all the documents in support thereof to be decided by us.
Oct. 14th The Commander Partieleir acting as Justice of the Peace and the Cordinater acting as Director of the Interior are entrusted each in that which concerns him with the execution of the present *obiere which shall be published and registered whenever necessary
Gabon December 8th 1866 For the R. Sbinal Commander Jupe of the settlements of the Gold Coasr and of Gaboon en tousence exparoroche.
Je commandens Partienleir Signed, Nube <pb facs="20170615_113918" By the Commander if Jossen Le Commandant Particulier de Justice of Peace Signed Aube
